content.rendered:
What is an Auditor?

Auditors examine the financial records of businesses and individuals to prove their legitimacy and legality. By analyzing and reporting their finals, they also give their clients recommendations on how to avoid risky financial situations.

Where does an Auditor work?

  • Accounting firms
  • Finance companies
  • Government

How much does an Auditor make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for an Auditor is $56,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Auditors?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Finance majors
  • Accounting majors
  • Business majors
Search relevant jobs

Auditor skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Auditors succeed in their work:

  • Strong mathematical background
  • Great interpersonal skills
  • Strong sense of organization

What are some common questions about Auditors?

Q: What are 3 types of audits?

A: External, internal, and IRS.
